ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
- fundamental physics concepts, including collisions, how pendulums work, rotational motion, and much more
- the basics of the experimental method in physics (ie, common tools, methods, and procedures)
- how to deal with uncertainty in experiments

I learned how to take a realistic approach to working in a lab. Many of the skills I gained such as being clear in my lab notes, being careful with measurements/uncertainties, or always trying to find ways to improve my work will be incredibly helpful for my academic and career future.
This course was really useful in helping me understand the concepts in PHYS 180. One example would be the gyroscopic precession lab.
How to apply physics concepts to real life!
I learned a basic understanding to various physics' lab techniques and how they applied to the real world.
I learned about the laws of physics and the applications of physics in daily life. I also learned how to conduct experiments at home and work to eliminate errors in my procedures.
Basic physics lab course. We learned about pendulums, collisions, uncertainty, etc.
loggerpro, stats
knowledge of physics concepts, taking measurements, uncertainties, presenting and discussing data
Physics lab

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
- strengths: very great and involved profs and TAs, very clear instructions and expectations, thorough feedback 
- weaknesses: none (except I didn't think the PLAs were super helpful for my learning experience and were more tedious than worthwhile)

I really loved how accomodating and welcoming this course and the teaching team were throughout the 5 week course. I couldn't have asked for a better way to learn physics! Having the built-in extensions and an incredible TA truly made this course exceptional and I am so grateful that I was a part of it.

One piece of feedback would be about the PLAs. Having PLAs really increased the workload due on Sundays and made the course a bit overwhelming. I also think having 3 PLAs was taxing and 1 or 2 would do and serve the purpose of getting us a hands-on experience.
Strengths of the course include a very clear instructions, interesting experiments, and amazing teaching assistants/professors. It could be improved by encouraging more group collaboration.
I actually really enjoyed how this class was set up. Everything felt practical to the class.
Interesting topics but it got a little tiring to watch all the videos online. the PLA assignments were a bit repetitive considering we had to turn in two lab reports a week already.

Strengths - well adapted to online learning, instructors were very enthusiastic and passionate

Weaknesses - very tedious work at times, a lot of busy work

The course does a great job trying to replicate the in-person experience for the online semesters. I think the lab-handouts do a great job explaining and helping students through understanding the material. The only thing I think that could be improved is an explanation of how the course will work at the very first lab because we were just thrown in without really knowing what to do. Additionally, I think it could be more explicitly explained what the expectations of the PLAs are.

Some of the labs are great and straight-forward, but some of the labs are hopelessly confusing and do not provide clarity about physics or physics lab techniques. This could be as a result of the online format through which I took both physics general labs.

Most of the labs were too long to finish during the lab session. So, I had to finish the end of the lab by myself, without a professor or TF there. There aren't really office hours for this course, which is another significant weakness, as there isn't always time to talk about the material during the lab session. I think the labs could be shortened without any detrimental effect on learning. A couple office hours/week would be helpful. More coordination between the professors and TF could also improve the course, as I'd sometimes get conflicting instructions from the profs, TFs, and the lab handouts.

Strengths: well-taught, lots of support, interesting labs that were all doable, the workload was manageable
Weaknesses: all the labs except maybe one went over the 3 hours of the lab

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It's helpful to take along with the lecture course since it reinforces many concepts covered in 180! You probably have to take it if you're pre med/need it for your major, but it's pretty worthwhile
Yes! Physics lab was an amazing experience and would highly recommend the class even to those who don't have to take it for their major.
Yes, it was a great accompaniment to PHYS 180.
If you have to take it as a premed requirement then you should!
I would not recommend this course to another student unless it was a pre-requisite.
Yes, I think it's pretty interesting for a lab course. I think it does a pretty good job producing a good online experience where students can still learn a lot.

If you need to take it, yes (like as a premed or physics major). Otherwise, no, don't waste your time on a class that won't really enhance your education and understanding of physics. That being said, it is a pretty easy class to be successful in as compared to other labs I have taken, so that is a plus.

Only if it's required. The grading is fine and it's not all that much work, but the 3-hour sessions and the long labs are a pain. I think it'd be hard to take at the same time as 180 unless you have a good physics background already.
Yes I think this online-lab was well taught and personally saved some time in terms of lab set up if you're not going into physics/need those lab skills
